intro: Hypochaeris toltensis, commonly known as the Toltens yellowstar, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, typical of the genus Hypochaeris. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in disturbed soils and open areas. Hypochaeris toltensis is also notable for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in some regions.
